title: MarkItDown: Python tool for converting files and office documents to Markdown
dot:
digraph MarkItDown{layout="dot";node[shape=box, style=filled, color=lightgray];subgraph cluster_main{label="MarkItDown Repository";style=dashed;markitdown[label="MarkItDown\n(Python tool for converting files to Markdown)", shape=ellipse, color=lightblue];files[label="Supported File Types", shape=box3d];api[label="API Usage", shape=box3d];contributions[label="Contributing", shape=box3d];license[label="License: MIT", shape=box3d];code_of_conduct[label="Code of Conduct", shape=box3d];issues_prs[label="Issues & Pull Requests", shape=box3d];stars_forks[label="Stars: 1.5k\nForks: 36", shape=box3d];files->markitdown[label="Converts"];api->markitdown[label="Example API"];contributions->markitdown[label="Welcomes"];license->markitdown[label="MIT Licensed"];code_of_conduct->markitdown[label="Adopts"];issues_prs->markitdown[label="Community"];stars_forks->markitdown[label="Popularity"];}node[shape=plaintext, style=solid, color=black, fontcolor=black];files_list[label=<
Supported File Types
PDF.pdf
PowerPoint.pptx
Word.docx
Excel.xlsx
ImagesEXIF, OCR
AudioEXIF, Transcription
HTMLSpecial Handling
Text Formatscsv, json, xml
>];api_example[label=<
API Usage Example
             from markitdown import MarkItDown             markitdown = MarkItDown()             result = markitdown.convert("test.xlsx")             print(result.text_content)
>];files_list->files;api_example->api;}
